sentences: Start with an overview sentence: setting + main action.

questions.question: What is the best overall description of 'Waiting at a Crosswalk'?
choices: A calm indoor meeting with formal presentations
People in a public setting engaged in an everyday activity
A private ceremony with an audience and a stage
A laboratory experiment with specialized equipment
questions.explanation: The scene title and context point to a public setting and routine activity rather than a formal ceremony, lab, or meeting.

speakingTasks.prompt: Describe the scene in 'Waiting at a Crosswalk'. What do you notice first?
Explain how the setting in 'Waiting at a Crosswalk' affects the mood of the people.
Predict what might happen next in 'Waiting at a Crosswalk' and give one reason.

writingTasks.prompt: Write a short description of the photo and summarize the main mood in 'Waiting at a Crosswalk'.
Explain the relationship between the people and the setting in 'Waiting at a Crosswalk'. Use at least two specific details.
writingTasks.sampleAnswer: In 'Waiting at a Crosswalk', the setting provides clear context for the people’s actions. Overall, the scene feels purposeful because the subjects seem engaged and oriented toward a shared goal. For example, their body language suggests focus, and the environment appears to support that activity. As a result, the mood is more organized than casual, which indicates that the moment is part of a routine rather than a spontaneous event.

writingTasks.prompt: Some people prefer busy environments, while others prefer quiet ones. Using 'Waiting at a Crosswalk' as inspiration, state your preference and support it with reasons.
writingTasks.sampleAnswer: I prefer quieter environments because they help me think clearly and work efficiently. In contrast, busy places can be distracting and make it harder to focus. For example, when I study in a calm space, I can organize my ideas and finish tasks faster. A possible explanation is that fewer interruptions reduce mental fatigue. Overall, choosing a quiet environment leads to better concentration and less stress, which improves my performance.

examTips: Start with a one-sentence overview before details.
Use location phrases (foreground/background) to organize your description.
Avoid guessing; hedge with 'it appears' or 'it is likely'.
Include 2–3 specific details (objects, actions, setting) to support ideas.
Use linking words (overall, in contrast, as a result) for coherence.
Speak steadily and manage time: plan 5 seconds, speak 40–45 seconds.

analysis.setting: a city intersection with a marked crosswalk
analysis.colorsLighting: Daylight; neutral city palette; traffic signals add sharp points of color.
analysis.actions: standing still, waiting for the signal, and observing traffic
analysis.bodyLanguage: still posture and forward-facing gaze, suggesting patience and situational awareness

descriptions.beginner: Two women hike on a forest trail with pine trees and tall mountains in the background. It takes place in a city intersection with a marked crosswalk. Use simple sentences to describe people, actions, and objects.
descriptions.intermediate: Two women hike on a forest trail with pine trees and tall mountains in the background. Setting: a city intersection with a marked crosswalk. Atmosphere: calm, neutral, observant, patient. This lesson builds both everyday and academic language for describing the photo clearly, making inferences, and organizing ideas for TOEFL tasks.
descriptions.advanced: Two women hike on a forest trail with pine trees and tall mountains in the background. The setting suggests: a city intersection with a marked crosswalk. Overall tone: calm, neutral, observant, patient. A strong response highlights concrete visual evidence, then adds cautious inference (what is likely happening and why) without over-claiming. You will build academic vocabulary and structured answers for TOEFL-style speaking, writing tasks.
descriptions.simple: Two women hike on a forest trail with pine trees and tall mountains in the background. It takes place in a city intersection with a marked crosswalk. Use simple sentences to describe people, actions, and objects.

sceneNotes: Focus on what you can SEE (people, setting, actions).
- Simple: Mostly Present Continuous (am/is/are + V-ing) + basic 'There is/There are' for objects.
- Intermediate: Adds prepositional phrases (at/on/near), quantifiers (several/a few/a lot of), and 1 relative clause (who/that/where).
- Advanced: Adds inference language (probably/likely/might), contrast/linkers (while/whereas/in addition), and optional passive voice when relevant.
Add 1–2 inferences (why they are there, how they feel).
Use at least 2 collocations in your speaking/writing.

exercises.name: 30-second photo description
exercises.prompt: Describe the photo in 3 sentences: (1) setting, (2) people + action, (3) feeling.
steps: Sentence 1: Where are they? (place + weather/light)

exercises.name: 45-second structured speaking
exercises.prompt: Speak with structure: overview → details → inference → wrap-up.
steps: Overview: one sentence about the scene.
Details: 2–3 details (foreground/background).
Inference: make 1 reasonable guess.
Wrap-up: summarize the mood.
tips: Use present continuous for what you see.

exercises.name: 6-minute paragraph (TOEFL style)
exercises.prompt: Write one paragraph (80–120 words) describing the photo and adding one personal connection.

model.en: The photo shows forest walk conversation: friendship on the trail with a calm, inspiring atmosphere. In the foreground, the people seem focused and relaxed as they take in the view. In the background, the landscape looks wide and dramatic, which makes the moment feel special. I have had a similar experience on a weekend trip, and it reminded me how refreshing nature can be. After this moment, they will probably keep exploring and take more photos.

proDescriptions.label: TOEFL Speaking (45–60s)
proDescriptions.text: This photo shows two women hiking in a green forest. They are carrying backpacks and walking side by side while talking and smiling. The light looks like early morning, and the trees make the setting feel calm. Overall, it seems like they are enjoying a friendly hike together.

proDescriptions.label: Academic Description
proDescriptions.text: The image captures two hikers in mid-conversation along a wooded trail. Their outdoor attire and backpacks suggest a recreational trek, while the filtered sunlight and dense tree line establish a serene natural environment. The subjects’ expressions convey companionship and ease.

proDescriptions.label: Narrative Style
proDescriptions.text: Their footsteps match without trying. Between jokes and small plans—where to stop, what to eat, how far to go—the forest keeps unfolding ahead of them, bright with morning light.

sceneDescription: Two young women in hiking clothes walk along a forest trail and talk to each other with relaxed smiles. Each carries a backpack, and tall trees frame the path while mountains appear faintly in the background. Morning sunlight filters through the branches, creating a warm, friendly feeling of connection and shared travel.

Two hikers walk through a green forest, smiling as they chat on a sunny path. اطرافشان 2 backpacks، Forest path و Pine trees دیده می‌شود و فضا Friendly، Relaxed و Enjoying the hike است. لباس‌ها، مثل Sleeveless/short-sleeve tops و Hiking backpacks (blue + gray/black) هم با موقعیت و محیط هماهنگ است.

grammarUsed.en: Present continuous for actions now, there is/are for visible objects, and adjectives/prepositions for setting and mood.
grammarUsed.fa: حال استمراری برای کارهای در جریان، there is/are برای اشیای قابل مشاهده، و صفت/حروف اضافه برای توصیف محیط و حس.

en.tense: Present Continuous (am/is/are + V‑ing) for actions happening now in the photo.
howToBuild: Choose the subject (who?): they / the family / the coworkers.
Pick an action you can SEE and use am/is/are + V‑ing.
Add place details with prepositions: at, in, on, near.
Add one short feeling sentence: They look… / The atmosphere feels…
examples: The friends are Walking and talking.
There are 2 backpacks and Forest path in Forest hiking trail.
The atmosphere feels Friendly.

fa.tense: حال استمراری (am/is/are + فعل ing) برای کارهایی که همین الآن در عکس در حال انجام است.
howToBuild: اول فاعل را انتخاب کن (چه کسی؟): they / the family / the coworkers.
یک کاری که در عکس می‌بینی انتخاب کن و با am/is/are + ing بساز.
جزئیات مکان را با حروف اضافه اضافه کن: at, in, on, near.
یک جمله کوتاه درباره حس اضافه کن: They look… / The atmosphere feels…
examples: آن‌ها در حال Walking and talking هستند.
در Forest hiking trail 2 backpacks و Forest path دیده می‌شود.
فضا Friendly به نظر می‌رسد.

scenarios.title: A memory
scenarios.en: Last weekend, I found myself on Forest hiking trail. Two hikers walk through a green forest, smiling as they chat on a sunny path. At first, I noticed 2 backpacks, Forest path, Pine trees and the way people were walking and talking. Then I looked closer: their clothing (Sleeveless/short-sleeve tops, Hiking backpacks (blue + gray/black)) and their expressions made the scene feel friendly, relaxed, enjoying the hike. After that, something small happened that changed the mood, and we had to respond quickly. In the end, we solved it, and the moment became a story I still remember.
scenarios.fa: آخرِ هفته‌ی قبل Forest hiking trail بودم. Two hikers walk through a green forest, smiling as they chat on a sunny path. اول 2 backpacks، Forest path و Pine trees را دیدم و اینکه آدم‌ها چطور Walking and talking. بعد دقیق‌تر نگاه کردم: لباس‌ها (Sleeveless/short-sleeve tops و Hiking backpacks (blue + gray/black)) و حالت چهره‌ها باعث شد فضا Friendly، Relaxed و Enjoying the hike به نظر برسد. بعدش یک اتفاق کوچک افتاد که حال‌وهوا را عوض کرد و مجبور شدیم سریع واکنش نشان بدهیم. آخرش حلش کردیم و همان لحظه تبدیل شد به خاطره‌ای که هنوز یادم می‌ماند.

grammarUsed.en: Past simple with time marker (last weekend) and sequencing (at first/then/after that/in the end).
grammarUsed.fa: گذشته ساده با قید زمان و ترتیب رخدادها (اول/بعد/بعدش/آخرش).

en.tense: Past Simple (V2) to tell a short memory, plus sequencing words (first/then/finally).
sentenceStructure: Time markers: yesterday / last week / a few minutes ago.
howToBuild: Start with a time phrase: Yesterday, Last weekend, A few minutes ago…
Change the main action into past simple (reviewed, chose, played…).
Use sequencing words to make a clear story: first, then, after that, finally.
End with a result or feeling: Everyone felt… / It turned out…
examples: Yesterday, the friends walked and talking.
Then, the friends checked 2 backpacks and continued.
Finally, they felt Friendly about the outcome.

fa.tense: گذشته ساده (Past Simple) برای تعریف یک خاطره کوتاه، همراه با کلمات ترتیب‌دهنده (first/then/finally).
sentenceStructure: عبارات زمانی: yesterday / last week / a few minutes ago
howToBuild: با یک عبارت زمانی شروع کن: Yesterday, Last weekend, A few minutes ago…
فعل اصلی را به گذشته ساده تبدیل کن (reviewed, chose, played…).
از کلمات ترتیب‌دهنده استفاده کن: first, then, after that, finally.
با نتیجه یا حس تمام کن: Everyone felt… / It turned out…
examples: دیروز، The friends walked and talking.
بعد، The friends 2 backpacks را بررسی کرد و ادامه داد.
در نهایت، آن‌ها درباره نتیجه Friendly بودند.

scenarios.title: Reflection
scenarios.en: Over the past few months, I have started paying attention to scenes like this. I have noticed that details such as 2 backpacks, Forest path, Pine trees are not background; they guide the story. I have also learned how actions like hiking uphill/along the trail can signal feelings such as friendly, relaxed, enjoying the hike. Since then, I have taken more time to observe before I speak, and my descriptions have become clearer and more specific.
scenarios.fa: در چند ماه گذشته شروع کرده‌ام به صحنه‌هایی مثل این بیشتر دقت کنم. متوجه شده‌ام جزئیاتی مثل 2 backpacks، Forest path و Pine trees فقط «پس‌زمینه» نیستند؛ آن‌ها مسیر داستان را تعیین می‌کنند. همچنین یاد گرفته‌ام کارهایی مثل Hiking uphill/along the trail چطور می‌تواند احساساتی مثل Friendly، Relaxed و Enjoying the hike را نشان بدهد. از آن زمان بیشتر قبل از حرف زدن مشاهده می‌کنم و توصیف‌هایم واضح‌تر و دقیق‌تر شده است.

grammarUsed.en: Present perfect to connect past learning to the present, plus since/over the past to frame experience.
grammarUsed.fa: حال کامل برای وصل کردن یادگیری گذشته به حال، همراه با «در چند ماه گذشته/از آن زمان».

en.tense: Present Perfect (have/has + past participle) to connect past experience to the present; use since/for/already/yet.
howToBuild: Say what has happened up to now (experience/result).
Use since (a starting point) or for (a duration).
Add a contrast or reflection: however, although, even though.
Finish with what they are doing now (present continuous) if needed.
examples: The friends have already handled similar situations before.
The friends have learned to stay Friendly in Forest hiking trail.
Although it looks routine, the details have mattered.

fa.tense: حال کامل (have/has + شکل سوم فعل) برای ربط دادن گذشته به حال؛ همراه با since/for/already/yet.
howToBuild: بگو تا همین الآن چه تجربه/نتیجه‌ای اتفاق افتاده.
از since (نقطه شروع) یا for (مدت زمان) استفاده کن.
یک جمله‌ی بازتاب/تضاد اضافه کن: however, although, even though.
اگر لازم شد با یک جمله حال استمراری وضعیت الآن را بگو.
examples: The friends قبلاً موقعیت‌های مشابهی را تجربه کرده است.
The friends یاد گرفته است در Forest hiking trail Friendly بماند.
اگرچه کار روتین به نظر می‌رسد، جزئیات مهم بوده‌اند.

scenarios.title: A challenge
scenarios.en: If we were to replay this moment on Forest hiking trail, one small change could create a big problem. If 2 backpacks, Forest path had been missing or damaged, we would have had to improvise. Someone might have said, “We should slow down and check,” and another person could have replied that we were running out of time. In a situation like this, we should prioritize safety and clarity, even if it means changing the plan. If I had ignored those details, I might have misunderstood the whole scene.
scenarios.fa: اگر قرار بود این لحظه در Forest hiking trail دوباره تکرار شود، یک تغییر کوچک می‌توانست یک مشکل بزرگ بسازد. اگر 2 backpacks و Forest path نبود یا آسیب دیده بود، مجبور می‌شدیم بداهه تصمیم بگیریم. ممکن بود کسی بگوید «باید آهسته‌تر برویم و بررسی کنیم» و نفر دیگری جواب بدهد که وقت کم داریم. در چنین موقعیتی بهتر است ایمنی و شفافیت را در اولویت بگذاریم، حتی اگر مجبور شویم برنامه را تغییر بدهیم. اگر آن جزئیات را نادیده می‌گرفتم، شاید کل صحنه را اشتباه می‌فهمیدم.

grammarUsed.en: Conditionals for hypotheticals, modals for advice/possibility, and short reported speech (might have said/could have replied).
grammarUsed.fa: شرطی‌ها برای موقعیت فرضی، افعال کمکی برای امکان/پیشنهاد، و نقل‌قول غیرمستقیم برای بازگویی گفت‌وگو.

en.tense: Mixed grammar for higher-level storytelling: conditionals, modals (might/must), and reported speech.
sentenceStructure: Second conditional: If + past simple, would + base verb.
Third conditional: If + had + V3, would have + V3.
Modals of deduction: might/must/can't + base verb.
Reported speech: He said (that) … / She asked if …
howToBuild: Describe the challenge and add a hypothetical solution (If…, would…).
Use modals to infer causes from the photo (They might…, It must…).
Add reported speech for realism: Someone said that…
Finish with a consequence or lesson learned.
examples: If the friends had checked 2 backpacks earlier, they would have avoided a mistake.
They might be under pressure, but they must stay Friendly.
The supervisor said that every detail mattered.

fa.tense: گرامر ترکیبی سطح بالا: شرطی‌ها، افعال کمکی (might/must) و نقل قول غیرمستقیم (reported speech).
sentenceStructure: شرطی نوع دوم: If + past simple, would + فعل ساده.
شرطی نوع سوم: If + had + V3, would have + V3.
نقل قول غیرمستقیم: He said (that)… / She asked if…
howToBuild: چالش را بگو و یک راه‌حل فرضی اضافه کن (If…, would…).
با مدال‌ها درباره علت‌ها حدس بزن (might/must).
برای واقعی‌تر شدن از reported speech استفاده کن.
در پایان نتیجه یا درسِ داستان را بگو.
examples: اگر The friends زودتر 2 backpacks را چک کرده بود، اشتباه را جلوگیری می‌کرد.
ممکن است تحت فشار باشند، اما باید Friendly بمانند.
سرپرست گفت که هر جزئیاتی مهم است.
